metadata.notes: Evidence summaries and key findings with provenance.

data.text: Indiana jails’ real per-person costs average around $60–$85/day; an Indiana Sheriffs’ Association study cited ~$74/day; state reimbursement rates have lagged these costs.

provenance.title: Indiana Department of Correction readies to pay $12 million in back jail payments

data.text: Treat-and-release ED visits average roughly $750 nationally (2021); consumer cash-price estimates often fall around $2,400–$2,600 without insurance.

provenance.title: Costs of Treat-and-Release Emergency Department Visits in the United States, 2021 (Statistical Brief #311)
Using the ER for Non-Emergencies Is Expensive

data.text: Housing First / PSH produces net public savings; U.S. median benefit ≈ $18,247 vs. ~$16,479 cost (~1.8:1 benefit-to-cost).

provenance.title: Permanent Supportive Housing With Housing First – Economic Review (Community Guide)
Systematic research review finds benefits of Housing First programs in U.S. outweigh costs

data.text: In the Denver Social Impact Bond evaluation, supportive housing cut police contacts and jail days and reduced emergency department visits by ~40%.

provenance.title: Supportive Housing Leads to Greater Housing Stability, Less Jail Time, and Cost Savings
What we learned from the evaluation (Denver SIB)
